content.question: Based on findings from a recent study on womenâ€™s health, researchers created a 90 percent confidence interval of <math alttext="0.42 comma 0.48" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.42</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>0.48</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> to estimate the percent of all women who do not find time to focus on their own health. Based on the confidence interval, which of the following claims is not supported?

choices.label: Less than half of all women do not find time to focus on their own health.
More than 40 percent of all women do not find time to focus on their own health.
Approximately 45 percent of all women do not find time to focus on their own health.
More than 45 percent of all women do not find time to focus on their own health.
More than 25 percent of all women do not find time to focus on their own health.

content.answer: More than 45 percent of all women do not find time to focus on their own health.

topic.text: 6.3: Justifying a Claim Based on a Confidence Interval for a Population Proportion

skill.text: Skill 4.D: Justify a claim based on a confidence interval.
